tweet: Want to stay up to date about the work I'm doing in Washington for #AZ01 families? Subscribe to my e-newsletter, here:  http://bit.ly/30MrFsu

It is past time for something to be done for domestic violence survivors in Indian Country. I intro'd the SURVIVE Act to provide legal, medical, & counseling resources to #AZ01 tribal communities, & increase the allocation of Crime Victims Fund monies provided to tribes. pic.twitter.com/01mzIRT38Z

Last month, I voted to pass bipartisan legislation to make it harder for scammers to spoof fake phone numbers & spam you with robocalls. These calls put hardworking #AZ01 families at risk of being the victims of fraud. pic.twitter.com/e9JfGPE2ex
Coming to Washington for the long weekend? Visit my website to see what tours and tickets my office can secure for you: #AZ01 http://bit.ly/2Umc6FE

Transparency and accountability are not partisan issues. This spring, I introduced a package of five ethics bills to hold lawmakers and government officials accountable to hardworking #AZ01 families. Learn more: pic.twitter.com/ts3jJk40Eg

This is unacceptable. We must find compromises that lower our greenhouse gas emissions & protect our water and natural resources for the next generation without hampering our economy, but rolling back regulations on methane is not the solution. #AZ01 https://wapo.st/2UeuuQy

There is no reason that teachers across America should be some of the lowest paid professionals in the workforce. Their jobs are critical to the economic vitality of our country. I introduced H.Res.58 to support increased public school teacher pay and education funding. #AZ01 pic.twitter.com/KNyny9WCiW

The Office of Congressional Ethics is imperative to preserving transparency and accountability in Washington. I introduced the CLEAN Act to strengthen this important group and protect it from partisan attacks. Learn more: #AZ01 pic.twitter.com/qgGnRXVFSQ

ICYMI: This month, I hired a new dedicated vets service representative to serve vets throughout #AZ01. Our vets have served our nation bravely, & it is our responsibility to ensure they have access to the resources they were promised when they return home. http://bit.ly/2ZnfeGL

ICYMI: Last month, the House of Reps voted to pass my amendment to the Raise the Wage Act that would require the nonpartisan Government Accountability Office to conduct an analysis to determine the impact the wage raise would have on the economy. #AZ01 http://bit.ly/3274qJL
Interested in honoring an #AZ01 veteran or a loved one with a flag flown over the US Capitol? You can order one through my office, here: http://bit.ly/2ZoHSHB

Last week, I stopped by the future site of the Oro Valley Incubator, a public/private partnership that includes the University of Arizona & aims to serve as an innovation hub for STEM research. I enjoyed learning about the jobs and economic growth this will bring to #AZ01. pic.twitter.com/wpyOLAexij

We must continue to identify opportunities for growth in our rural economies, including investment in education and job skills training programs. Learn about the work I'm doing to improve the economy of rural #AZ01: http://bit.ly/342lh2m
Community health centers are critical to the health of #AZ01 families. I'm honored to be able to advocate for policies that allow them to continue their important work.

#AZ01 MOBILE OFFICE HOUR ALERT: If you're in the Window Rock area tomorrow, my staff is hosting office hours to connect you with constituent resources. Stop by the Navajo Nation VA between 10 am and 2 pm. Details: pic.twitter.com/zqOqRRqvnu

Last week, it was my pleasure to stop by the Marana Police Department and Northwest Tucson Fire Station and present our hardworking first responders with flags flown over the US Capitol. #AZ01 pic.twitter.com/MusikuTzky

Next Wednesday, I am hosting a hands-on workshop on the federal budget for constituents in the Flagstaff area. Attendees will work together in groups to create mock federal budgets, and then we will discuss the process in Washington. Details: #AZ01  https://www.facebook.com/events/478696359592165/ …

PAGE: My staff is hosting mobile office hours from 11 am to 2 pm tomorrow at the Community Center. If you're having an issue with a federal program, such as Medicare or Social Security, caseworkers in my office are trained to assist you. #AZ01 pic.twitter.com/RMPmBbv5wv

Tomorrow, I am hosting #AZ01 open office hours at my Northwest Tucson office. If you are in the area, I encourage you to stop by and share your questions and concerns with me. Details: pic.twitter.com/H6yehiACIw
We need to act on climate change. The President should not be skipping an international meeting on a topic with such global importance. #AZ01 http://bit.ly/2U3DNTr

Happy #InternationalDogDay to our official Government Watchdog and Constituent Pawsitivity Representative, Winston. This best good boy celebrated by spending a relaxed morning catching up on impawtent news. pic.twitter.com/TjRYvlFL1l

On Friday, I was humbled to witness the naturalization ceremony of 250 new U.S. citizens hailing from 53 different nations. Diversity is part of what makes our nation great; it was a pleasure to meet these hardworking individuals & their families. #AZ01 http://bit.ly/2HrewNH

Senator McCain was a model of true public service. He reached across the aisle & put party aside to find solutions to the problems facing our nation. Today, my thoughts are w/ Cindy & the entire family. Senator McCain will forever be remembered as a hero. http://bit.ly/2NvilFz

Happy Birthday, @NatlParkService! #AZ01 public monuments & parks are critical for land & water conservation & preserving the rich history of our country, & I will continue working with my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to ensure they are protected. http://bit.ly/2MzVPeX

ICYMI: Last month, I joined @repbenraylujan to intro legislation to expand compensation for individuals exposed to radiation while working in & living near uranium mines or downwind from nuclear weapon test sites in #AZ01 & throughout the southwest. http://bit.ly/2LXee4u

#AZ01 is one of the largest districts in the nation, but my staff travels all over the state bringing resources and assistance to constituents. For a full list of my mobile office hours, visit: http://bit.ly/2qMH78N

The American people deserve accountability from their elected officials in Washington. This year, I introduced the Taxpayers DIME Act to increase oversight of government air travel. Learn more: #AZ01 pic.twitter.com/jpSTsOafAF

Our veterans served bravely, and when they return from defending our country, they deserve our support and respect. I’m pleased Rudy will be joining our team to serve #AZ01 veterans and ensure they receive the benefits and honors they have earned. http://bit.ly/2ZnadJq

Saturday, I met w/ Teec Nos Pos community members & educators to hear about funding struggles many tribal schools face. Congress has a responsibility to establish full funding for BIE; I will continue to work w/ my colleagues to ensure this is a reality for #AZ01 Indian Country. pic.twitter.com/DKzTW0ftLY

When I came to Washington in 2017, I made a promise to work across the aisle to hold our elected officials accountable, promote rural economic development, and honor #AZ01 veterans. Learn more about my legislative priorities by visiting my website:  http://bit.ly/2WWJXEK  pic.twitter.com/noQ6VGYvYd

Last week, I hosted a domestic violence and sexual assault awareness roundtable in Window Rock to hear from survivors and resource providers on the Navajo Nation. Learn about the legislation I've introduced to aid #AZ01 DV and assault survivors here:  http://bit.ly/2SuZ2uW  pic.twitter.com/U27lFzjAf7

Friday, I was humbled to be a part of the @24thnnc meeting to hear about the concerns of the Navajo Nation and learn how Congress can engage with these issues. Thank you to Speaker Seth Damon for having me. #AZ01 pic.twitter.com/Gm5IuksaVr

Hardworking #AZ01 families should never have to endure another government shutdown due to partisan gridlock. This spring, i introduced the NO FLIGHTS Act, which would require lawmakers to continue working and remain in Washington, DC during a government shutdown. pic.twitter.com/xhwi2ILrHZ

Last week, I had the pleasure of stopping by the Navajo Communications Center to meet with staff and tour the facilities. We must continue to support businesses and initiatives that create jobs in tribal and rural communities in #AZ01. pic.twitter.com/FpR06C4VFU

Tomorrow, my staff is hosting mobile office hours at two different #AZ01 locations. If you're having trouble with a federal program or agency, I encourage you to stop by. Details: pic.twitter.com/twF5ssr7e5
Record breaking temperatures are hitting Arizona this week, including many areas in #AZ01 For info on excessive heat warnings and the resources available to you, visit: http://bit.ly/2Hh0uhD

Transparency is not a partisan issue. The American people deserve accountability from their elected officials. I am pleased to have been able to host so many town halls this year, and hear from countless #AZ01 families about the issues important to them.  http://bit.ly/2HeFzMa
Happy 244th Birthday, Tucson! #AZ01 pic.twitter.com/9MeVwXcc76

Caseworkers on my staff work tirelessly to assist constituents in resolving issues with federal agencies. To see firsthand how my staff has been able to help #AZ01 families, visit my website: http://bit.ly/2N6OYcv

Great spending an afternoon with the @NatlParkService learning about Glen Canyon Dam energy production and efforts to promote tourism while preserving our natural resources. Thanks for having me! pic.twitter.com/FqKph0tEbS

Job creation and retention are crucial to the #AZ01 communities. I was glad to be able to stop by the Grand Opening of the Re-employment Center this week and see the efforts of small businesses and city advocates come to fruition. http://bit.ly/306ajpX

Last week, I attended the 2019 Rural Policy Forum and was able to meet with constituents, local government officials, and stakeholder groups. I look forward to continuing to work together to identify ways we can expand rural economic development in #AZ01 http://bit.ly/31FlBSx

This year, I introduced legislation to make federal court more accessible for rural #AZ01 families and tribal communities. Last week, the President signed my bill into law. Learn more: http://bit.ly/31It8jG

Wednesday, I toured the Gary Yamamoto Custom Baits Factory to learn about their production process and the many jobs they bring to the Page area. Businesses such as this are absolutely vital to rural economic development in #AZ01. pic.twitter.com/cR2UDSj0c2

ICYMI: Last week, I joined members of the AZ delegation to send a letter to the Acting Secretary of the Air Force requesting more aerial refueling tankers for AZ bases. Read more on our request & its importance to our national security operations: #AZ01 http://bit.ly/2Z5YvqM

Yesterday, I held a round table with #AZ01 Native American women veterans to hear about what kinds of changes they want to see in the VA system. Our veterans have faithfully served our country, and it is our responsibility to ensure they have the best care when they return home. pic.twitter.com/11a2DHEd83

Tuesday, I sat down with Chapter Officials in Leupp to discuss funding for flood control and related infrastructure projects on tribal lands. Thank you for the time you took to give me a firsthand look at the kind of damage we must work together to repair. #AZ01 pic.twitter.com/Hj5WkU7wGP

Congressman Steve King’s comments have long been reprehensible. We are a nation of diverse ideas & thoughts, but that does not give our leaders license to espouse divisive, hurtful rhetoric. We are elected to lead, but it is clear Rep. King is not doing that. He should resign.

I had the pleasure of speaking & taking questions at the Diné Bi Olta School Board Association Summer Conference. Congress has a responsibility to ensure full funding for BIE, & I will continue working with my colleagues to make sure this is a reality for #AZ01 Indian Country. pic.twitter.com/R46tv053ma

#AZ01 MOBILE OFFICE HOUR NOTICE: Tomorrow, members of my staff are at the Camp Verde Library answering your questions about federal programs and agencies. If you have an issue you're dealing with, I urge you to stop by. pic.twitter.com/Xc0uGSlIl6

I was humbled to present the family of Private Starlie Lomayaktewa w/ a posthumously awarded Purple Heart & Bronze Star. My #AZ01 staff worked hard to secure these much-deserved honors for Private Lomayaktewa's next of kin; I was honored to be a part of the presentation ceremony. pic.twitter.com/cvHCoGnlBJ

One of the most important tenets of our democracy is the ability citizens have to speak directly to their elected representatives. Today we honor and recognize the service of the brave Navajo Code Talkers. Their efforts saved lives and turned the tides of battle in our favor. #AZ01 #NavajoCodeTalkersDay https://twitter.com/DineMillennials/status/1161660948240723971 …

CONCHO: Today, caseworkers on my #AZ01 staff are at the Stanford General Store to answer questions you may have about a federal agency or program. If you have questions or concerns, I urge you to stop by. Details: pic.twitter.com/RyY1dJgx9D

We have a responsibility to ensure federal funding is adequately allocated to Native Nations & Tribes for programs that promote public health, safety, & education. Today, my prayers are with Chairman Lupe’s family and loved ones and the White Mountain Apache Tribe as they mourn the passing of this great leader. #AZ01

It was an honor to have known & worked with Chairman Lupe over the years. Great to be in Pinetop-Lakeside & St. Johns over the weekend for more #AZ01 town halls and open office hours. I am proud to work with my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to ensure Medicare provides access to this promising new cancer therapy for seniors nationwide. #AZ01 https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2019/08/07/medicare-will-cover-pioneering-cancer-treatment-nationwide/ …

Today, President Trump signed into law my bill that expands the list of locations in which court may be held to include Flagstaff and Yuma, ensuring that rural #AZ01 residents will no longer have to drive hundreds of miles to access their court system. http://bit.ly/31t2dYP

#AZ01 communities face the threat of wildfires every year. High temps & drought make our forests & deserts susceptible to unpredictable fire behavior. Check out the Williams Visitor Center's celebration of Smokey Bear & learn wildfire prevention tips: http://bit.ly/2OM3pVG

Counterfeit prescription pills have led to a scourge of fatalities across #AZ01 in recent years. I implore you to protect yourself and your loved ones by practicing caution when seeking out and purchasing prescription drugs. http://bit.ly/2OGYtBp

AZ is home to premier installations for combat air power; I joined my  colleagues to request more aerial refueling tankers for our bases. Flexibility to respond to natl security challenges relies on cooperation from all levels of our armed forces. #AZ01 http://bit.ly/33nc2JR

Next Tuesday, I'll be speaking at the grand opening of the Northern Arizona Region Re-Employment Center in #AZ01. Join me to learn about the opportunities the center provides, including career training, certification programs, & job-seeker assistance. http://bit.ly/2GRW2G7

Great to sit down with the Navajo-Hopi Observer to discuss my work in Washington, including my new bill that would repeal outdated, racist laws related to tribal communities. Learn more about my efforts to improve the lives of #AZ01 families: http://bit.ly/2Tbdc6x

Since the original passage of the Special Diabetes Program for Indians, the rate of diabetes has declined across #AZ01 tribal lands. Today, my heart is breaking for the victims of the shootings in El Paso and Dayton. I pray for healing for the loved ones of the victims and these communities. Senseless violence of this kind has no place in our country and together we must take action to end it.

This August, I'll be traveling throughout the district meeting with #AZ01 families. To stay up to date on my town halls and mobile office hours, I encourage you to sign up for my e-newsletter:  http://bit.ly/2nIrEnU

Fostering a healthy educational environment at a young age is critical for future academic achievement for #AZ01 students. Learn about the work I'm doing in Washington to elevate Arizona's school system: http://bit.ly/2YGcu6h
The Chinle High School boy's basketball team has brought so much pride and hope to #AZ01. Looking forward to watching this docuseries:  http://bit.ly/2LY0Aio

In communities throughout northern Arizona, families are struggling with the toxic legacy of uranium mining. We must ensure that current uranium mining bans are upheld, as well as work together to identify funding for remediation efforts. http://bit.ly/2JZG65b

#AZ01 veterans have faithfully served our country, & it is our responsibility to ensure they have the best care when they return home. This year, I was proud to work w/ local, state, & federal stakeholders to secure funding for a new vet home in Flagstaff. http://bit.ly/2ZiFL3L

Rural communities make up the very fabric of America; their success is our nation’s success. I am looking forward to this year's Rural Policy Forum and encourage #AZ01 rural advocates and stakeholders to attend. Learn more: http://bit.ly/2OAUOp3

This spring, I held a hands-on workshop on the federal budget with #AZ01 constituents. It was wonderful getting to see participants work together to reach consensus the same way Congress must. I look forward to hosting another workshop this fall. http://bit.ly/2MLYSlt
